snippet: Reports that progress was being made helped build hope that the city’s public schools could reopen on Monday.
abstract: Leaders on both sides of Chicago's teacher strike voice optimism that a deal could soon be reached, bringing an end to the walkout that has halted classes for 350,000 students in the nation's third-largest school system.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and STEVEN YACCINO
byline.contributor: Steven Greenhouse contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Reports that progress was being made helped build hope that the city’s public schools could reopen on Monday.

headline.seo: Both Sides in Chicago Teachers’ Strike Adopt Upbeat Tone
headline.main: Fresh Hopes for End to Chicago Teacher Strike by Weekend
headline.print_headline: Four Days Into Chicago Teachers’ Strike, Both Sides Adopt Upbeat Tone
